name: regrind
content:
regrind verb [T]
(FORM PIECES)
Add to word list
Add to word list
to make something into small pieces or a powder for a second, third, etc. time by pressing it between hard surfaces : Sift out the large almond chunks, regrind them, and sift again. Any oversized material is removed and returned to the mill to be re-ground.
More examplesFewer examplesMix in ground cloves, ground cinnamon, and ground fennel seed and regrind the mixture until very fine.Some pieces are too large to be processed in the power plant's boiler, and periodically, a grinder is brought in to re-grind them.Regrinding a second time with a mortar and pestle helps mix up the spices.

regrind verb [T]
(MAKE SMOOTH)
to rub something for a second, third, etc. time against a hard surface in order to make it sharper or smoother: Keep this in mind when regrinding a screwdriver’s tip. He planned to re-grind the sides of the box.
More examplesFewer examplesCertain components are impossible to obtain for these engines, so existing parts must be reground and processed.If the pipe is badly scored, it may need regrinding.The points were re-ground to eliminate the cracks.
